name: formyl peptide receptor 2
other_names: lipoxin A4 receptor (formyl peptide receptor related)

kegg.name: Neutrophil extracellular trap formation - Homo sapiens (human)

pid.name: Urokinase-type plasminogen activator (uPA) and uPAR-mediated signaling

reactome.name: Formyl peptide receptors bind formyl peptides and many other ligands

summary: Enables amyloid-beta binding activity; scavenger receptor binding activity; and signaling receptor activity. Involved in several processes, including cellular response to amyloid-beta; positive regulation of monocyte chemotaxis; and regulation of defense response. Located in cytoplasm and plasma membrane. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
